alert.note: Alert for Sheridan Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 22 at 8:29PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...SCATTERED STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN BIG HORN...WESTERN POWDER RIVER...SOUTHERN ROSEBUD AND NORTHEASTERN SHERIDAN COUNTIES THROUGH 900 PM MDT... At 826 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking scattered strong thunderstorms around 23 miles south of Lame Deer, or 41 miles northeast of Sheridan, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 40 to 50 mph and heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Heavy rainfall will cause a quick and significant drop in visibility, along with ponding of water on roadways, making travel difficult. Locations impacted include... Lame Deer, Ashland, Birney, Otter, Moorhead, Muddy Cluster, Birney Village, and Northern Cheyenne Indian Reservation. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
